name: Annual industrial robots installed
descriptionShort: Industrial robots are automated, reprogrammable machines that perform a variety of tasks in industrial settings.
descriptionKey: The use of robots with AI-based software shows how AI is being applied in the real world.
Industrial robots are machines used in factories to automate tasks like welding, assembly, and packaging.
They are defined as automatically controlled, reprogrammable, and multipurpose machines that can move in three or more directions.
Reprogrammable means their functions can be changed through software without altering their physical parts.
Multipurpose means they can be adapted for different tasks with mechanical changes.
Robots are becoming easier to install and more flexible, which means even small production runs can be automated.
Companies use robots to improve product quality, increase speed, reduce waste, and cut costs.

origins.titleSnapshot: AI Index Report - Data on Robots
origins.title: AI Index Report
origins.descriptionSnapshot: Data on the installation and operation of industrial robots, which are defined as an “automatically controlled, reprogrammable, multipurpose manipulator, programmable in three or more axes, which can be either fixed in place or mobile for use in industrial automation applications.”
origins.description: The AI Index Report tracks, collates, distills, and visualizes data related to artificial intelligence (AI). The mission is to provide unbiased, rigorously vetted, broadly sourced data to enable policymakers, researchers, executives, journalists, and the general public to develop a more thorough and nuanced understanding of the complex field of AI.
origins.producer: International Federation of Robotics (IFR) via AI Index Report
origins.citationFull:
Nestor Maslej, Loredana Fattorini, Raymond Perrault, Yolanda Gil, Vanessa Parli, Njenga Kariuki, Emily Capstick, Anka Reuel, Erik
Brynjolfsson, John Etchemendy, Katrina Ligett, Terah Lyons, James Manyika, Juan Carlos Niebles, Yoav Shoham, Russell Wald,
Tobi Walsh, Armin Hamrah, Lapo Santarlasci, Julia Betts Lotufo, Alexandra Rome, Andrew Shi, Sukrut Oak. “The AI Index 2025
Annual Report,” AI Index Steering Committee, Institute for Human-Centered AI, Stanford University, Stanford, CA, April 2025
